meanings.definition: A cultural group within a larger culture, often having beliefs or interests at variance with those of the larger culture.
meanings.sent1: In big cities, you can find different subcultures like skateboarders or hip-hop fans.
meanings.sent2: The subcultures of gamers and book lovers have their own unique ways of connecting with each other.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, the subcultures of superheroes and villains clashed in a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: The subcultures of art and science intersect in fascinating ways, creating new forms of expression.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the subcultures of fashion and music can open up a whole new world of creativity.

meanings.definition: The cultural patterns, beliefs, and practices of such a group.
meanings.sent1: Studying the subcultures of different regions helps us understand their unique traditions.
meanings.sent2: The subcultures of ancient civilizations provide insights into their daily lives and rituals.
meanings.sent3: In the small town, the subcultures of knitting and gardening were highly respected by all.
meanings.sent4: The subcultures of cooking and baking blend together to create delicious culinary experiences.
meanings.sent5: Immersing yourself in the subcultures of storytelling and folklore can transport you to magical realms.
